title: People's Crusade: A Seljuk Turkish army successfully fight off the People's Army of the West.
text: People's Crusade: A Seljuk Turkish army successfully fight off the People's Army of the West.

title: First Crusade: Crusaders led by Godfrey of Bouillon, Bohemund of Taranto, and Raymond IV, Count of Toulouse, begin the Siege of Antioch.
text: First Crusade: Crusaders led by Godfrey of Bouillon, Bohemund of Taranto, and Raymond IV, Count of Toulouse, begin the Siege of Antioch.

title: Otto IV is crowned emperor of the Holy Roman Empire by Pope Innocent III.
text: Otto IV is crowned emperor of the Holy Roman Empire by Pope Innocent III.

title: Nanboku-chō, Japan: Emperor Go-Kameyama abdicates in favor of rival claimant Go-Komatsu.
text: Nanboku-chō, Japan: Emperor Go-Kameyama abdicates in favor of rival claimant Go-Komatsu.

title: Martin Luther joins the theological faculty of the University of Wittenberg.
text: Martin Luther joins the theological faculty of the University of Wittenberg.

title: Ferdinand Magellan discovers a strait now known as Strait of Magellan.
text: Ferdinand Magellan discovers a strait now known as Strait of Magellan.

title: João Álvares Fagundes discovers the islands of Saint Pierre and Miquelon, bestowing them their original name of "Islands of the 11,000 Virgins".
text: João Álvares Fagundes discovers the islands of Saint Pierre and Miquelon, bestowing them their original name of "Islands of the 11,000 Virgins".

title: Tokugawa Ieyasu defeats the leaders of rival Japanese clans in the Battle of Sekigahara, which marks the beginning of the Tokugawa shogunate.
text: Tokugawa Ieyasu defeats the leaders of rival Japanese clans in the Battle of Sekigahara, which marks the beginning of the Tokugawa shogunate.

title: First display of the word "Liberty" on a flag, raised by colonists in Taunton, Massachusetts in defiance of British rule in Colonial America.
text: First display of the word "Liberty" on a flag, raised by colonists in Taunton, Massachusetts in defiance of British rule in Colonial America.

title: In Boston Harbor, the 44-gun United States Navy frigate USS Constitution is launched.
text: In Boston Harbor, the 44-gun United States Navy frigate USS Constitution is launched.

title: Napoleonic Wars: Battle of Trafalgar: A British fleet led by Vice Admiral Lord Nelson defeats a combined French and Spanish fleet under Admiral Villeneuve.
text: Napoleonic Wars: Battle of Trafalgar: A British fleet led by Vice Admiral Lord Nelson defeats a combined French and Spanish fleet under Admiral Villeneuve.

title: Joseph Aspdin patents Portland cement.
text: Joseph Aspdin patents Portland cement.

title: Florence Nightingale and a staff of 38 nurses are sent to the Crimean War.
text: Florence Nightingale and a staff of 38 nurses are sent to the Crimean War.

title: American Civil War: Battle of Ball's Bluff: Union forces under Colonel Edward Baker are defeated by Confederate troops in the second major battle of the war.
text: American Civil War: Battle of Ball's Bluff: Union forces under Colonel Edward Baker are defeated by Confederate troops in the second major battle of the war.

title: The Medicine Lodge Treaty is signed by southern Great Plains Indian leaders. The treaty requires Native American Plains tribes to relocate to a reservation in western Oklahoma.
text: The Medicine Lodge Treaty is signed by southern Great Plains Indian leaders. The treaty requires Native American Plains tribes to relocate to a reservation in western Oklahoma.

title: Thomas Edison applies for a patent for his design for an incandescent light bulb.
text: Thomas Edison applies for a patent for his design for an incandescent light bulb.

title: Foundation of the Swiss Social Democratic Party.
text: Foundation of the Swiss Social Democratic Party.

title: Opening ceremonies for the World's Columbian Exposition are held in Chicago, though because construction was behind schedule, the exposition did not open until May 1, 1893.
text: Opening ceremonies for the World's Columbian Exposition are held in Chicago, though because construction was behind schedule, the exposition did not open until May 1, 1893.

title: The Republic of Formosa collapses as Japanese forces invade.
text: The Republic of Formosa collapses as Japanese forces invade.

title: HMS Niobe arrives in Halifax Harbour to become the first ship of the Royal Canadian Navy.
text: HMS Niobe arrives in Halifax Harbour to become the first ship of the Royal Canadian Navy.

title: First Balkan War: Kardzhali is liberated by Bulgarian forces.
text: First Balkan War: Kardzhali is liberated by Bulgarian forces.

title: President Warren G. Harding delivers the first speech by a sitting U.S. President against lynching in the deep South.
text: President Warren G. Harding delivers the first speech by a sitting U.S. President against lynching in the deep South.

title: The Sakurakai, a secret society in the Imperial Japanese Army, launches an abortive coup d'état attempt.
text: The Sakurakai, a secret society in the Imperial Japanese Army, launches an abortive coup d'état attempt.

title: The first edition of the Ernest Hemingway novel For Whom the Bell Tolls is published.
text: The first edition of the Ernest Hemingway novel For Whom the Bell Tolls is published.

title: The Provisional Government of Free India is formally declared by Subhas Chandra Bose.
text: The Provisional Government of Free India is formally declared by Subhas Chandra Bose.

title: World War II: The first kamikaze attack. A Japanese fighter plane carrying a 200-kilogram (440 lb) bomb attacks HMAS Australia off Leyte Island, as the Battle of Leyte Gulf began.
text: World War II: The first kamikaze attack. A Japanese fighter plane carrying a 200-kilogram (440 lb) bomb attacks HMAS Australia off Leyte Island, as the Battle of Leyte Gulf began.

title: World War II: Nemmersdorf massacre against the German civilians takes place.
text: World War II: Nemmersdorf massacre against the German civilians takes place.

title: World War II: Battle of Aachen: The city of Aachen falls to American forces after three weeks of fighting, making it the first German city to fall to the Allies.
text: World War II: Battle of Aachen: The city of Aachen falls to American forces after three weeks of fighting, making it the first German city to fall to the Allies.

title: Women's suffrage: Women are allowed to vote in France for the first time.
text: Women's suffrage: Women are allowed to vote in France for the first time.

title: Korean War: Heavy fighting begins between British and Australian forces from the 27th British Commonwealth Brigade and the North Korean 239th Regiment during the Battle of Yongju.
text: Korean War: Heavy fighting begins between British and Australian forces from the 27th British Commonwealth Brigade and the North Korean 239th Regiment during the Battle of Yongju.

title: Mau Mau Uprising: Kenyan rebel leader Dedan Kimathi is captured by the British Army, signalling the ultimate defeat of the rebellion, and essentially ending the British military campaign.
text: Mau Mau Uprising: Kenyan rebel leader Dedan Kimathi is captured by the British Army, signalling the ultimate defeat of the rebellion, and essentially ending the British military campaign.

title: In New York City, the Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum, designed by Frank Lloyd Wright, opens to the public.
text: In New York City, the Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum, designed by Frank Lloyd Wright, opens to the public.

title: U.S. President Dwight D. Eisenhower signs an executive order transferring Wernher von Braun and other German scientists from the United States Army to NASA.
text: U.S. President Dwight D. Eisenhower signs an executive order transferring Wernher von Braun and other German scientists from the United States Army to NASA.

title: Comet Ikeya–Seki approaches perihelion, passing 450,000 kilometers (279,617 miles) from the sun.
text: Comet Ikeya–Seki approaches perihelion, passing 450,000 kilometers (279,617 miles) from the sun.

title: Aberfan disaster: A colliery spoil tip collapses on the village of Aberfan in Wales, killing 144 people, mostly schoolchildren.
text: Aberfan disaster: A colliery spoil tip collapses on the village of Aberfan in Wales, killing 144 people, mostly schoolchildren.

title: Vietnam War: More than 100,000 war protesters gather in Washington, D.C.. Similar demonstrations occur simultaneously in Japan and Western Europe.
text: Vietnam War: More than 100,000 war protesters gather in Washington, D.C.. Similar demonstrations occur simultaneously in Japan and Western Europe.

title: A coup d'état in Somalia brings Siad Barre to power and establishes a socialist republic in Somalia.
text: A coup d'état in Somalia brings Siad Barre to power and establishes a socialist republic in Somalia.

title: A gas explosion kills 22 people at a shopping center in Clarkston, East Renfrewshire, near Glasgow, Scotland.
text: A gas explosion kills 22 people at a shopping center in Clarkston, East Renfrewshire, near Glasgow, Scotland.

title: Fred Dryer of the Los Angeles Rams becomes the first player in NFL history to score two safeties in the same game.
text: Fred Dryer of the Los Angeles Rams becomes the first player in NFL history to score two safeties in the same game.

title: Australian civilian pilot Frederick Valentich vanishes in a Cessna 182 over the Bass Strait south of Melbourne, after reporting contact with an unidentified aircraft.
text: Australian civilian pilot Frederick Valentich vanishes in a Cessna 182 over the Bass Strait south of Melbourne, after reporting contact with an unidentified aircraft.

title: Moshe Dayan resigns from the Israeli government because of strong disagreements with Prime Minister Menachem Begin over policy towards the Arabs.
text: Moshe Dayan resigns from the Israeli government because of strong disagreements with Prime Minister Menachem Begin over policy towards the Arabs.

title: Andreas Papandreou becomes Prime Minister of Greece, ending an almost 50-year-long system of power dominated by conservative forces.
text: Andreas Papandreou becomes Prime Minister of Greece, ending an almost 50-year-long system of power dominated by conservative forces.

title: The metre is defined at the seventeenth General Conference on Weights and Measures as the distance light travels in a vacuum in 1/299,792,458 of a second.
text: The metre is defined at the seventeenth General Conference on Weights and Measures as the distance light travels in a vacuum in 1/299,792,458 of a second.

title: In Lebanon, pro-Iran kidnappers claim to have abducted American writer Edward Tracy (he is released in August 1991).
text: In Lebanon, pro-Iran kidnappers claim to have abducted American writer Edward Tracy (he is released in August 1991).

title: Jaffna hospital massacre is carried out by Indian Peace Keeping Force in Sri Lanka killing 70 ethnic Tamil patients, doctors and nurses.
text: Jaffna hospital massacre is carried out by Indian Peace Keeping Force in Sri Lanka killing 70 ethnic Tamil patients, doctors and nurses.

title: North Korea nuclear weapons program: North Korea and the United States sign an Agreed Framework that requires North Korea to stop its nuclear weapons program and agree to inspections.
text: North Korea nuclear weapons program: North Korea and the United States sign an Agreed Framework that requires North Korea to stop its nuclear weapons program and agree to inspections.

title: In Seoul, 32 people are killed when the Seongsu Bridge collapses.
text: In Seoul, 32 people are killed when the Seongsu Bridge collapses.

title: Images of the dwarf planet Eris are taken and subsequently used in documenting its discovery by the team of Michael E. Brown, Chad Trujillo, and David L. Rabinowitz.
text: Images of the dwarf planet Eris are taken and subsequently used in documenting its discovery by the team of Michael E. Brown, Chad Trujillo, and David L. Rabinowitz.
